words.definition: An alarm is something that warns people of danger.
words.example: When the students heard the fire alarm, they left the building.

words.definition: When people or things are apart, they are not close together.
words.example: The couple decided to live apart from each other.

words.definition: To arrest someone means to catch them for doing something bad.
words.example: The man was arrested for breaking the law.

words.definition: An award is a prize someone gets for doing something well.
words.example: He got an award for having the best grades.

words.definition: A breed is a group of animals within a species.
words.example: I have a special breed of dog.

words.definition: A bucket is a round container used to hold things like water.
words.example: We used a bucket to carry the water.

words.definition: A contest is a game or race that people try to win.
words.example: The boy won the spelling contest.

words.definition: To convict someone means to prove that they did a crime.
words.example: The man was convicted of stealing the car.

words.definition: A garage is a part of a house where people keep a car.
words.example: My father put his car in the garage.

words.definition: A journalist is a person who writes news stories.
words.example: The journalist wrote a story about the fire.

words.definition: A pup is a young dog.
words.example: All the pups followed their mother.

words.definition: To qualify is to get the right to do something.
words.example: He qualified for the race by running very fast.

words.definition: To repair something is to fix it.
words.example: I repaired my bike after the accident.

words.definition: To resume something means to start it again after a break.
words.example: The game resumed after the rain stopped.

words.definition: To rob is to take money or things from a person or place.
words.example: A man tried to rob the bank.

words.definition: To slip is to slide and fall.
words.example: I slipped on the ice and fell down.

words.definition: Somewhat means a little bit.
words.example: The test was somewhat difficult.

words.definition: A stable is a building where horses are kept.
words.example: The horses were in the stable.

words.definition: A tissue is a soft piece of paper.
words.example: I used a tissue to blow my nose.

words.definition: A yard is an area of land next to a house.
words.example: The kids played in the yard.
